fast3d

Interface Renderable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Illuminatable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvTriangle, Callout, CrosshairHUD, Group, HUD, Line, Object, Pixel, Rectangle, Scene, Triangle

    public interface Renderable
    Renderables can be passed to a universe to receive a render()-call during the render-process of the universe
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color getColor() 
      Vector3d getPos()
      should not return null
      should return a reference (should not must)
      Vector3d[] getVertices()
      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
      may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
      Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
      during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything

    • Method Detail

      • getVertices

        Vector3d[] getVertices()
        should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
        a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
        may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
        Returns:
        all the vertices used during render

      • shade

        void shade(Graphics3d s)
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null

      • render

        void render(Graphics3d g)
        called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
        Parameters:
        g - the 3d-graphics-context to do drawings, not null

      • getColor

        Color getColor()
        Returns:
        the current visible color of the renderable (preferred as a reference)

      • rayTrace

        Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d s,
                  Vector3d r)
        for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
        may return null
        Parameters:
        s - the start-point of the ray
        r - the direction-vector of the ray
        Returns:
        the puncture-point with the ray

      • getPos

        Vector3d getPos()
        should not return null
        should return a reference (should not must)
        Returns:
        the center-position of the renderable used to determine when the render-call should be done between call of other renderables in the universe to not hide this one behind some renderable actually behind it
